title: Margherita Skillet Pizza
description: A quick, rustic Margherita pizza cooked entirely in a cast-iron skillet for a blistered crust, bubbling tomato sauce, and fresh basil. Bright tomato, creamy mozzarella, and fragrant basil combine for a classic Italian flavor with minimal fuss.

ingredients.notes: room temperature, enough to form a 10–11 inch skillet pizza

ingredients.display_name: tomato sauce (simple crushed tomatoes or pizza sauce)
ingredients.notes: smooth or slightly chunky, seasoned to taste

ingredients.display_name: fresh mozzarella, torn or thinly sliced

ingredients.notes: divided: for skillet and dough edge
optional: sauté briefly in oil for aroma
adjust to taste; for sauce and dough edge
optional: to balance the acidity of tomatoes
prevents sticking and crisps the bottom

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: tear or thinly slice mozzarella and bring dough to room temperature; measure sauce, oil, and herbs.
Heat a 10–12 inch cast-iron skillet over medium heat, add half the olive oil and swirl to coat; sprinkle the cornmeal evenly across the bottom.
Stretch or roll the dough into a circle slightly larger than the skillet; transfer dough to the skillet and press to form a rim, leaving a slightly thicker edge.
Cook the dough on the stovetop for 3–4 minutes until the bottom begins to brown and set, reducing heat if the crust browns too fast.
Quickly spread the tomato sauce over the partially cooked crust, leaving the edge clear; season sauce with salt, pepper, and optional sugar or oregano.
Distribute the torn mozzarella evenly over the sauce and drizzle remaining olive oil around the crust edge; add minced garlic now if using (do not overpile cheese).

Increase heat to medium-high for 30 seconds to help the bottom crisp, then transfer the skillet to a preheated oven set to 500°F (260°C) or under the broiler (high) to finish—cook until cheese is bubbling and the crust is blistered, about 6–8 minutes under oven heat or 3–5 minutes under a close broiler, watching closely.
Remove skillet from oven using oven mitts; scatter fresh basil leaves over the hot pizza and let rest for 2 minutes to set.
Brush the crust with a little olive oil if desired, sprinkle with red pepper flakes to taste, slice and serve directly from the skillet.
